title: Tully smashes Hollywood's glamorous image of motherhood.
review: Tully is a return to form for both director Jason Reitman and writer Diablo Cody. Featuring great performances, an unflinching and engrossing look on motherhood and a witty, acerbic script. Tully is a film worth looking out for.

title: One of those movies that reminds you to use birth control
review: Older, tired new mom. Distant, immature husband. Enter night nurse and many post partum induced events.

title: Charlize in a waitress uniform
review:
ROCKS.

Schwing. Love love love. Clean woman in a movie and she has a fantasy and overcomes obstacles. End of story.
